text: Have unplanned guests? Need food fast? Order Noon O Kabab to go! I was on the corner of Western and Lawrence when my friends called unexpectedly to let me know they were coming over. I didn't have any food at home to serve so I was about to drive to Pita Inn in Skokie to get some Mediterranean food. Then I remembered a good friend of mine told me there's a really good kabob place on Kedzie so two minutes later, I arrived at Noon O Kabab. They have two locations within less than a block radius. One restaurant is sit down and the other is self serve (order to go). The place has parking but be aware, it's really, really packed. You're lucky if you find parking in the actual lot, stick to street parking if you can, it's rather hard to get out of the parking lot. Anyways, I walked in and the line wasn't too long and since it was my first time there, I let the cashier know I needed enough food for four people. The cashier suggested getting  the Joujeh platter (two skewers of juicy marinated chicken on an open fire served with rice) and Koubideh platter (two skewers of ground sirloin beef seasoned with Persian seating and also served with rice). The cashier even asked me if I would like it served family style and I said yes. I also ordered their homemade hummus. My total was about $56 dollars for two platters and hummus and I was told it would be about a fifteen minute wait. The place is clean, the bus woman and boy were busy picking up dirty dishes, sweeping the floors and making sure everything was tidy. The place was packed but it has a beautiful ambiance and aura to it, the wall art is charming as well. My food was done in less than 15 mins and the richness of the food smelled my entire car up! I have to admit, I was a little disappointed when I opened the food up when I got home, there was double the rice in comparison to the meat. There was a good amount of chicken but considering I ordered two skewers of beef, there was double the amount of chicken in comparison to beef- even though I ordered two skewers of each!! I have to admit, they serve significantly bigger pieces of chicken on the skewer and that could be the reason for the significant difference in portions. Either way, I served half the platter of rice and then all the chicken and beef on one platter and thank goodness we had enough food. Truthfully, if we didn't have other food available, we wouldn't have been able to feed three people nevertheless four. Even though the chicken was juicy, it tasted bland next to the rice. The chicken is great but even with the small side of grilled veggies and rice, there's something missing to make this platter excellent. Maybe it's the lack of salad or a sauce? I don't know but it's missing that extra key ingredient that would make this meal mind blowing. If you don't eat the chicken while it's hot, it become a little dry with the rice so I ate it with the hummus. Their hummus is really, really delicious and I ate the whole small serving in one sitting. The chicken and hummus paired together taste really good!!  I do intend to come back and try the rest of the items on their menu!

Come and taste, probably, the most wonderful Persian food in the city. The food is delicious and the prices are not prohibitive at all. I ordered the salmon and I was not disappointed. The salads, the rice and all the food is very fresh. The portions are right and very flavorful. Drink some of their  tea, add sugar, and enjoy some Mesopotamian food, right on the north side of Chicago.

The food is here is always good.  But this review is only two stars because after coming here for over 12 years, I was disappointed by the portion size (so much so that I asked the server if they were bringing another plate with the remainder). Maybe it doesn't seem like a big deal, but my lamb shank was so small, it seemed comical compared to the huge amount of rice they gave. On top of that, when I asked to not get the rice or alternatively, to substitute it for hummus (expecting to pay an additional charge), I was told the dish only comes one way.  Good food. Mediocre service. Poor serving size.

Best Persian restaurant in Chicago , they serve you best quality for food . Try Persian ice  cream saffron and fig for your dessert . Restaurant is clean and you can see Persian carpets hanging on wall. The manager  was super professional and she take care of all the customers!! Definitely recommending

Great place for take out, especially for lunch. Great value (more like $ than  $$ ) at least for lunch. Very tasty and flavorful items. I like both the lamb and chicken kabobs and the Persian rice is nice.

I just had a Barg there and there was hair in my tomato . I addressed that to my server(Dennys) and never heard of a apology from her or the manager and after paying she just threw the check on the table and left.  Really disappointing.

My husband and I drove a long way from the suburbs to come and eat here and were so excited to experience the food. We waited 10 minutes to be seated and when a waitress finally showed up, a rude female manager/supervisor immediately tasked her with something.  The server seemed scared of her and left us standing there still, so we seated ourselves. We sat there for 14 minutes without anyone coming to the table.  No menu, no water, NOTHING. After 24 minutes total wasted at this place, we gave up and left. We had such high hopes and left starving with nothing but a ridiculous amount of driving time and a terrible impression of this place.  So dejected and disappointed.  Maybe the food is wonderful, we will never know.
First Persian food experience outside of the food cooked by my Persian friend, but this place was really great! We had a wide variety of food and loved all of it!
We held a party last night and our Noon O Kabab was a big hit!  We had meat eaters, vegetarians, picky kids and everyone was happy!  Great customer service too!  Thank you!
Hi- I and family recently visited this restaurant for a dinner. We loved the food and great service. We were also pleased and impressed by the manager Grace's hospitality.  Thanks again.
On our way to Seattle, WA we stopped at this place for dinner. Simply, fantastic food, very reasonable prices, and friendly staff. Certainly recommended!

When I'm craving a hearty meaty meal this is what I want. I've been here a couple times so I wanted to put in my review. We were coming home from a long day out and we were all starving. My husband decided to order the family platter and 2 ash soups. We didn't realize how huge the family platter was until we got it. We didn't eat inside the restaurant and just got carry out because of our tired kids. So the family platter includes a large tray of half dill rice and half regular. It also includes a huge tray of the mixed meats pretty much every grilled meat item you can think of. So it has the barg, koubideh, chenjeh, and joujeh(pretty much it's grilled filet mignon, ground beef kebabs,, ribeye, ground chicken kebabs, and chicken breast). You get one long skewer of each or more. It was delicious. The meat is flavorful, slightly smokey, tender and juicy. The ashe soup is so delicious it's a vegetarian soup with beans, and tons of herbs (I think spinach, parsley, etc). It's really good but my kids didn't like it it was too healthy for them. This is definitely my favorite Place to get Iranian/Persian food.  In terms of service it was quick and friendly. Parking is fairly easy with a small parking lot outside the restaurant and lots of street parking nearby. I haven't decided if this place is really kid friendly. It's a little too nice for kids but you can totally take the kids here. Just rather do carry out with my young kids here. If you want some amazing grilled meats this is the place! Check it out. I included a video of the family platter!

Across the street is their self serve spot -- looked very good too. This one here is a sit down restaurant with full service (and full bar). Food was great, service during the meal was nice. If you go with a group: Get the family style meat dishes -- a little bit of everything and plenty for everyone.  Technically, five stars. Deducting two since I see it as a tremendous lack in service when a) we call ahead and when we show up they say: Let's see if we can even accommodate you and b) when six out of your party of eight are present, the place is empty and they send you out in the corridor to wait for the remaining two people instead of letting us start with apps. This ain't Manhattan...
The food is amazing.  Service is very good.  Parking is great.  Best Persian in Chicago.

If you like kabob, come here! The chicken was sweet and was cooked/grilled perfectly! The waitress we had did not come back after she took our orders but we were to hungry to care :). The food came out of the kitchen really fast, and the bread on the table was awesome.

To start simple, that was some excellent food. Obviously a Hidden gem in North Chicago/Albany Prk area. They have two variations of the restaurants-a full dining experience as well as a quick self service eat in joint right across the street from each other. Now that's thoughtful. Regardless, I inquired and the staff mentioned the food at both places is same, it's just the dining experience that differs. They also have secured fenced parking.  Moving on to the real stuff- food! My buddy who is also a big foodie like me, strongly recommended me to try their 'Barg', which is their marinated juicy filet mignon skewer-charbroiled. I am going to to the same here and recommend it to you. The steak was cooked perfectly and it almost melted in the mouth. It came with a gravy sauce with onion. Certainly try pouring it over your meat for enhanced flavor.  Other items we ordered were The koubideh, ground beef skewers and the Noon o joujeh, chicken kabab also well cooked and flavorful.  Thanks to @Yelp, for the free appetizer (check-in deal) we got the kash-ke-bademjan, roasted eggplant puréed with onions, garlic and aged yogurt served w warm pita. Never had that before but m glad we got that coz it was awesomeeee.  I did forget to try their saffron ice cream, and bunch of other luring items in their menu.  Certainly going back.
Hands down, the best Persian food in Chicago area. Great service as well. Make sure to try the soltanti and fesanjaan (walnut and pomegranate stew) Amazing flavors.
Love the atmosphere, and outstanding food! Very enticing and great place for an authentic Persian meal. Recommend NAK above any other Persian restaurants in town!

Hostess was very rude and we had to complain to a manager who promised to follow up.  Food quality was good, however, the taste was mediocre.  This place is certainly better than other Persian restaurants in Chicago but does not represent a great Persian food restaurant.

Best Persian food we've tried in Chicago. Prices were good. We had the double shishkabob, rice, tadig, and yogurt. Rice was so good! Followed by tea and bomieh (super sweet, but good with tea) Close to brown line, kedzie exit.

Tasteless chicken and rice was mushy. Rice tasted old and like they added water to reheat it. There are 2 locations across the street from each other. One is "casual" and the AC was turned off so there was a humid, misty disgusting smell. The other was more "formal" with a whiff of poop smell as soon as you enter the place because the restrooms are smack in front of you. The layout is confusing too. Avoid this place. I am highly suspicious of all these top reviews. Perhaps they don't know what tasty Persian food is supposed to taste like?

My family came in for father's day.  We waited a couple of minutes for someone to assist us because they were busy.  After we ordered our food, a guy came up to us and seemed to notice that we were waiting awhile.  He offered us hummus because of the waiting time. When we received the food, my parents were fully engaged and the food was great.  I would highly recommend this place.

I went here on a Friday with some friends since I heard that this place was good. I must say this place is great located in the heart of Albany Park. The food was really tasty and flavorful and it keeps your belly full. I order kebabs and they give you a good portion along with the dill rice. The appetizer we order which was the hummus and the baba ganoush was delicious along with the pita bread to dip in it. I had plenty of Mediterranean food and this will top as one of my favorite places. It is in one of my old neighborhood I used to lived in. This place is packed on a Friday night in knowing how great the food is. Can't wait to back and try other dishes and invite more friends.

No doubt one of the best Persian food in town but with food comes service and they are absolutely TERRIBLE & RUDE when it comes to that. They have no regard for people waiting outside , don't even check the names they put down and if someone just walks in they'll seat them before you if met by another server. Has happened to me twice now and they absolutely have no courtesy to be the least apologetic about it. I'd just order the food rather than even visit this place.

We made a return visit after several years to this relatively upscale Persian restaurant.  One noticeable change from our last visit:  the separate takeaway facility has moved to a new, modern building to the north of the main restaurant, where we went.  Not very busy on a Tuesday evening; we were seated at once, and given a relish tray consisting of hot pita, feta, raw onion, and radishes. Our party shared an eggplant appetizer, rather smoky, served with sour cream or perhaps yogurt. My entrée choice was something new to me:  pomegranate shrimp.  This consisted of jumbo shrimp and big mushroom caps in a tangy-sweet pomegranate sauce, served over basmati rice.  Excellent!  We'll really have to get here more often when visiting the neighborhood. Convenient to public transportation, adjacent to the Kedzie station on the Brown Line, and two blocks from the 81-Lawrence bus.  Private parking lot at the takeaway facility; street parking is hit or miss.

My favorite neighborhood place! I've been coming here for years, but infrequently since it was sort of 'far' from my 'hood. NOW I live a block away and am here like once a week. It's just so good! LOVE the kash ke bademjan (eggplant with caramelized onions and whey), the creamy hummus, and really any kababs--they are all tender and juicy! Plus, the dill rice is so tasty!  Family-owned and the service is always super nice and friendly.

Some friends recently catered a party with Noon O Kabab, and the dishes were excellent. I tried 8 of them, and they were all very delicious and high quality. The lamb kabab was probably my favorite, tender with a hint of char, followed by the chicken and beef kababs. Kash-Ke-Bademjan eggplant appetizer was very tasty. The roasted veggies and tabbouleh were also very good, the pita was super fresh and pillowy soft, and the different types of rice were very good as well. I'd return anytime to dine-in and try more dishes. This place had been on my radar for some time, and it did not disappoint.

By far the best Persian food in chicago. Especially their tahdig, fesenjoon, kabobs barg and koobideh, and chicken barg. Those are our favorites but it's all delicious. For my fellows Persians, they have real zereshk so their zereshk polo is also delicious. I love this place and their prices are extremely reasonable for the amount and value of the food. The waiters are also wonderful!

Another hidden gem. True flavors of Persian food. They have opened another outlet across the street as well. We had food at the old place. The interiors and staff are inviting. We were quickly given a seat and the server came with hot pita bread, feta cheese and salad (on the house) We had Lamb Shank, Dill rice, Lamb Kebob plate. All the items were very well presented and amazing taste. The lamb shank fell off the bone but I have had better ones. The best item was our appetizer Spicy Pomegranate Chicken Wings. They were juicy and well done with a smoked flavor. Though they named it spicy... was not spicy. My kid was happily had them.

Came here for lunch on Easter expecting it to be packed, but it wasn't! After that, things weren't too great.  I ordered the pomegranate shrimp with mushrooms, but the shrimp was undercooked. I guess I'll know next time not to order seafood off the menu.
I was told that this is the best Persian restaurant in town. It really is. The service is good and food tastes good.

I live closeby but had not tried it until tonight.  Great cuisine!! We ordered pickup and it exceeded all expectations...!  Falafel was excellent as was the lentil soup and the hummus.  The owner even through in some ice cream because they were slammed busy.  Nice people, quite the business... We will be back!
That's what we got after 40 mins waiting. I understand in the busy hours that happens, but 40 mins? Kidding?

Food wise: Noon-O-Kabab is unmatched. Their food is incredible and absolutely delicious and this place has been a family favorite of ours for years. Definitely our go-to. However...This past mother's day, it was packed inside of the waiting area (as expected). There were chairs that were already placed there with people sitting on them for about a good hour before. When those chairs freed up, my family decided to sit on them.  A few minutes later, I believe the owner (a woman with short hair, glasses) came out and literally was scolding at us about leaning against the wall because the Rug that was hanging was on sale. And she also scolded me for sitting on a chair that was leaning against that rug as well. And what was more upsetting was she kept going about it! First of all, there was no "for sale" sign or any signage for that matter anywhere near the rug. Second of all, there were people leaning all over that rug the entire day before us! How were we supposed to know? She annoyed everyone in my family and my mother wanted to say something but I didn't want her mother's day ruined so I discouraged her. So as a note: they value their rugs over their customers. If you don't believe me, lean on it and you'll get some nasty treatment from her. And i've heard things about her before from people and how she's upset them. The only reason why people come back is because how good their food is.

In the past Noon a Kabob has been a favorite of ours. Unfortunately today I was shocked by the unexpected rudeness of the staff when we came for dinner with a party of 12 (my sister's family being in town for our mother's funeral.) 1st the "greeter" failed to greet us; instead telling me that we shld go next door to the take-out place vs being seated in the restaurant. When I informed her tht we preferred to be served here, she reluctantly took down my name, telling me there were no seats available ( I told her it was fine, we would wait.) Secondly, when our party was waiting in the very narrow "waiting" area, another woman came by and treated my 20 yr old son and teenage niece horribly, telling them not to lean against the carpets on the wall because they are for sale and need to be sold (she even "moved" my niece who was by a bare wall!) There is no sign on the walls asking patrons not to touch the carpets and the carpet my son was leaning against is partially on the floor, obviously being walked on! I was so embarrased to expose my out of town, grieving relatives to such treatment! The food is good, so I am sincerely hoping this horrible treatment is just a fluke.
Execellent Persian food! I would say even better than the Kabobs you can find in iran.  All stars for flavor, quality and presentation! Thanks for the lovely experience
Love this place !! Love the amazing Persian food that is truly exceptional. Not enough stars to rate this perfect delicious food.

The family has been ordering and dining in year after year  at Noon O Kabon, that even the owner knows us by name lol. So I think it's about time to do a review.  -Customer service- Once we had delivery, and they had a new driver. The owner was so nice, that since they were late for my order, the owner herself delivered the food to my house! Can you say loyal? Nuff said  The kebabs here are always very juicy, and their rice won't disappoint. We usually get the chenjeh and koubideh (lamb, beef, and chicken), joujeh, lamb shank, the kifta, salmon, and shrimp. Their hummus & babaqinosh is also very good. If there's more than 10 of us we just order a couple of family platters. We usually get a hummus and greens with feta cheese appetizer free with our order. Since I like to try new things, I've recently decided to try out a new entrèe that they offer, and I did not like it at all. It's called Tah Dig with Ghormeh Sabzi. It's basically crispy dry over cooked rice scraped out of a pot with a green sauce ontop.  I wouldn't have it again because I could barely take a second bite out of it. I've also had the Caspian eggplant, I didn't like it much either. I think I'll just stick to the usual entrèes since they're pretty good and authentic Persian food. As for the Tah Dig, I don't know what that was... but I would have to say that it was the strangest entrèe I have ever had in my life. It left my face blank...
Hummus and baba ganush are two must things you must try. Deli rice is a flavoured rice which is very delicious. I love this place. Great ambiance. Oh phalafal is highly recommended. That's so tasty.

My favorite place to order take out! The food is amazing every single time. Always happy with everything each time I order. I always end up ordering way too much but it's worth it for the leftovers and great for next day. Love this place!!

I was in the area and decided to check out this restaurant because my wife had heard good things. WOW! Better than expected in every way. We ate the kashke bademjan to start and shared a lamb and redbean herb stew over dill rice and the kebab chicken. Everything was excellent, even the four-year-old loved it. Beautiful dining room with great ambiance, friendly and knowledgable waitstaff, who provided everything we needed before we even thought to ask. Portions are very large and a great value. On a personal note, I'd been looking for a restaurant that served kashke bademjan ever since my favorite restaurant closed, and to come across it so serendipitously really made my day, especially since it was so well executed. I know where I want to go for Fathers' Day this year for sure.

I had a great experience there. I had a Kobide with white rice and Chenje kabab, those were very delicious. If you want to try a Persian food especially kabab, I suggest all person just Noon o kabab in Chicago. When I come back to Chicago I must go there. In addition Noon o Kabab has a nice and hospitality manager.Thank you so much Noon O Kabab team.

We ordered to go and had various meat plates, soup, appetizers, and kashkebademjoon (eggplant).  Besides the food being delicious, it was  wrapped up very neatly to go.  Also the facility and wrapping were very clean which is important and why we will go back.  Really good job!
Really great food from extra nice people at a very reasonable price.
The food needed salt and pepper and i dont mean the female rap group . i  was told nothing but great things about this place but to be honest it wasnt worth the price .
Love this place. Great service.  Clean and fast. My favorite is the lamb and chocked very good soft and juicy

If you like ethnic food but don't want it spicy, you should definitely try Persian! The portions are generous and the meat is good quality, so for the price it is good. For example I got an a-la-carte single lamb kabob and I could only eat half of it because it was at least a foot long. Also service was friendly and the place is warm and family-like, clean, and classy (we ate on the table service side of the restaurant).   I really like flavorful food and I have to say the Ghormeh Sabzi was incredible - all fresh herbs cooked down into a stew, so super flavorful but not at all spicy or heavy. Unfortunately we were not impressed by the pomegranate mushrooms (my husband barely ate it because he found it sweet) and the eggplant dip starter (a little blander than we thought it would be), so for that reason I have to give it a 4 not a 5.   But coming back for seconds of the Ghormeh sabzi soon!

Restaurant made fraudulent charges on my credit card. I ordered carry out from this restaurant for an event. The restaurant gave us trays containing someone else's order and we ended up receiving only half of the food we had ordered. When I called the restaurant manager, the manager acknowledged the mistake but refused to refund the difference. My credit card company provide a charge back. After the charge back, however, the restaurant made unauthorized charge on my credit card for food we never received.

I had a brand new $200 outfit from zara. I made a pickup from noon kabob and they put my food in a big box that was leaking oil all over my shirt and pants as soon as i stepped out their door to put it in my car. Not good service if they did not check to make sure the trays are closed in the box.

Really delicious and authentic Persian food here! The staff are all very friendly, the menu has something for everyone, and there is plenty of seating but they do get busy (always a good sign)! We ordered the Caspian Eggplant, Barg, and the Soltani. Everything tasted amazing! The pita our server set on our table along with the cube of cheese, parsley, radish, and onions really got our appetites going for the rest of the food! The pita was so warm and fluffy! The Caspian Eggplant paired very well with the pita bread. It was lightly sweet and savory! It comes as a mash that spreads easily but can also be eaten with just a spoon dipped into the yogurt sauce that came with it. This is a nice appetizer to share with the table. The Barg was incredibly tender! Even the dill rice was flavorful! The filet mignon Alan of meat was huge but was also cut so easily with a knife! Each bite was tender and juicy! I could not stop eating it and every bite sent me to a blissful heaven! The Soltani came with the filet mignon slab of meat as well as a ground up sirloin which was equally as tender. The meats were so flavorful and paired with the dill rice was superb!  This is the spot to take someone as their first taste of Persian food! They will thank you later!
Great place to grab down Persian food. Love their kababs and the rice are flavorful too. Cannot go wrong with Noon O!
Food was great, service fast and friendly and prices even better. Had a wonderful experience and will definitely go back ...

I have been to this restaurant twice and their food was excellent. Meat was well- cooked and flavored as well as chicken. Basmati rice was perfectly cooked and aromatic. I liked the vegetable curry because veg were well cooked and their desserts were yummy .
Great food. Service was so so. I recommend the lunch specials. Had some surf and turf aka salmon kabab and steak kabab. Also the soup and salad and the baba g were great...

The heart wants what it wants, but on a cold and rainy night, I needed kababs.  My new friend with a Turkish wife suggested Noon O Kabab and a quick search told me it was within steps of the Brown line.   Ok, it's a Persian restaurant and I was jones'ing for a Beyti kabab, so I ordered one made with ground lamb and another with chunks of lamb.  Had to have the dill rice that everyone raves about.  My order came out quickly and it was delicious served with a small salad and a grilled tomato.

Anyone who knows anything about middle eastern food, specifically Persian cuisine, knows Noon O Kabob. This place has been here a long, long time and there is a reason for their success. Everything is delicious. Everything. I recommend the soltani plate - their barg is superb, but everything is superb. And despite their success they still are humble and dedicated to customer satisfaction. I picked up some food to go recently and the manager Elias went out of his way to introduce himself to me and inform me of their upcoming renovations. You must go here.

Get the chicken skewers with dill rice! I think it's called joujeh. We literally had all the appetizers and my favorite was these two eggplant with caramelized onions and red peppers with pita. Baba ganoush was awesome with pita. Super friendly waiter and the owners down to earth.

We went there on a Saturday night and it was very crowded. We ordered the shrimp and beef kebab and the chicken and beef kebabs with both kinds of rice. We also ordered the hummus. The food was very delicious and enjoyable, however the service was lacking and while the people who came in before us got their appetizer right away we did not receive ours until after we received our entrees and reminded the waiter of our order of hummus.
Good kefta kabob and dill rice. I suggest fine dining location if youre looking for a more relaxed environment.

My family and I come here pretty often and it's one of our favorites. The food is amazing! Especially for meat lovers. I always get the lamb and beef kebabs/kaboudeh. My family loves all the chicken and lamb items on the menu. We also love the egg plant puree appetizer and large portobello mushrooms appetizer. The owner is such a sweet lady and Jose is an awesome server!  Highly recommend!

In short, it's the promised land. The food is so amazing, so tasty, so flavorful, that once you've eaten at NOK there's no going back.  Forgive the somewhat brusque service, and skip the "casual" (and cold) NOK on one side of Kedzie -- instead, opt for the much more old-school white tablecloth restaurant.  We were afraid of being overwhelmed by rice, so we ordered one polo (rice dish), and three side kebabs along with a veggie and an appetizer. We had so much food that we'll have dinner for the next 2 nights. Dinner for 2 - $50.

Service is OK but they're nice people. The food on the other hand is absolutely knockout. This is one of the few places that I get the ribeye steak from and let me tell you that is what dreams are made of. They have delicious Tadig with the Ghorma Sabzi, doll rice, hummus and the dessert is good too. Their portions are large and the food is flavorful. It is a little bit more expensive since it's the fine dining, but totally worth it. They have other more casual locations. I haven't visited them yet, but I'd expect the food to be nothing short of fantastic.

Wow!! Never disappointed with the very authentic delicious food here, every option on the menu is a must try, the meats are tender and juicy, the rice aromatic and fluffy, everything is the best Persian food in Chicago by far! Don't forget the Persian tea, a word of caution because this food is addictive!!!!

I've lived in Chicago for over 20 years and I spent some time living in Iran years ago and Noon O Kabab is the closest I've ever found to eating food like I could get in Iran.  I love lamb and try it almost everywhere and they are THE BEST at preparing it.  I eat in, order pick up, and delivery and it's always great.  They're not inexpensive but it's amazing food and I always have more than enough leftovers for a second meal.

I had lunch here today. I loved it ! Tasty appertisers; included roasted eggplant w yogurt on top, dolmas. For main course absolutely fantastic grilled salmon w a delicious lemony dressings. Menu looks great and I look forward to try more dishes.  Cozy interior. Excellent service
Service was a little slow-we ordered drinks and waited a while for everyone to get what they ordered-but the food was good. We had a lot of people so we ordered the big platter. I would go back fors

I had a delicious meal here, recommended by a friend who had eaten at Noon O Kabab's Milwaukee location on the Northwest side.  Another Yelper had mentioned NOK was the best place place to get kebabs in Chicago, a claim which I will support from my first visit. We were drawn to this location by their free parking lot and the option for a quieter, white table-cloth sit down restaurant, versus the grab-and-go NOK location right across the street (north of Leland ).  They are basically the same establishment, split into two buildings so that you have the option of different dining experiences. Genius. I really enjoyed their Persian food. The five stars comes from a combination of good food, good service & good company.  Make sure to order their tea, subtly spiced with cardamom, and there will be a huge silver tin of sugar cubes on your table for sweetening. Shared amongst 4 people: Large hummus Joujeh Koubideh (chicken breast kebab); 2 skewers Koubideh (ground sirloin); 2 skewers Lamb Kabab; 2 skewers With each of our meat entrees we got 50-50 dill rice and white rice, served with charred tomatoes which were delicious.  I wish there were even more charred vegetables; some bell peppers and roasted onions would have tipped this near-perfect meal to perfection.  All their meat was tender, their chicken delicious with a generous drizzle of fresh lemon. Once you are seated, you get a basket of thin pita along with a spread of chopped onions, feta, and parsley.  You get a free appetizer under $7.50 were a Yelp Check-in and our group was unanimously down for a large hummus ($7.00).  Our server was attentive and kind.  We had a pitcher of water at our table and she checked in several times to ask how to food was or if we needed anything.  On a chilly Saturday afternoon before it got crowded, our group was well taken care of. For a group of four splitting our food family style, next time I would order two meat entrees (instead of three) and add a couple skewers on the side because we had a lot of rice left over. They have huge portions. Make sure to ask for a side of tahini and their house-made hot sauce (which is very mild). They were out of Baba Ghannouj when we went which was a bummer, but I will definitely come back here again.  Not only for the Baba Ghannouj for also for the Lamb Shank, the Yogurt salad, Pomegranate Wings, and a variety of their other appetizers.  Also, their saffron ice cream looks to-die-for. In all honesty, when I first heard their name "Noon O Kebab" I had no idea what to expect... but don't let that deter you.  You will not be disappointed.  The Albany Park area is so rich with different types of restaurants and bakeries to explore.  I would love to bring my family here since we love Middle Eastern & Mediterranean cuisine.  My sister and I were raised on Pita Inn, Grecian Kitchen, Dengeo's and Kabul House in Skokie so the next time we're reunited, NOK it is!
Love this place!! Their skewers and chicken kab and are awesome with a great place to dine in.

I came to the restaurant many years ago and I could state everything I sampled was excellent.  I had the same expectations when a friend of mine recommended we go.  Since then they now have a fast food service across the street.  We went in and wanted to order after looking at the menu.  2 other gentlemen jumped in front of us and started a 20 minute conversation with the one cashier.  Luckily another co-worker stepped in and took our order .   I ordered baba ghanoush and combo skewer platter.  The baba g came out with burnt pita.  I was hungry and dove in. Something did not taste right.  My brother n law makes homemade baba ghanoush all the time.  Every thing tasted burnt.   I got fresh pita.  But I realized it was the baba ghanoush that was burnt.  I left it ,when it was my favorite dish to eat.  Plus it was pricey for $7.  The skewers were excellent and I finished everything on the plate.   The serving staff were fully attentive and receive 5 stars.

This is the best place you can have the original taste of a Persian.  You have to try the polo rise is my favorite.  I will give five stars for the food quality.  But the service and waitresses are not happy by serving the customer i go there frequently properly ones a week and I always get bad service. The price is average we paid $60 for 2 which is great.

Had the lamb which was so tender, rice was good and appetizer was free through yelp which was a nice added bonus to the already delicious food. The waiter was extremely nice and gave us tea on the house. No complaints.

Amazing kabobs.  Family platter was huge.   Fed 5 of us with two appetizers and we're stuffed!    Desert bomeih was amazing and the chai oh my.  They honored the free appetizer from help too!   Mr. Peru ( Jose ) was awesome !!!

Great service.  Food was good but have had better for the price.  Wish they had better sauce to dip your shish kabobs.  I've had better chicken shish kabobs that had more flavor.  I felt everything was bland. Pita bread was not fresh.  Babaganoush was surprisingly bland.  Pita Inn is much better but for the neighborhood, it's not bad.  I've never had babaganoush I didn't like.  I was disappointed since this place seems highly successful but then again some people think PF Chang's serves awesome Chinese food.
Delicious food! The falafel wrap is delicious!! Great take out as well. A wonderful neighborhood place.

This restaurant is absolutely amazing. The food is delicious and the people who work there are so incredibly nice. My best friend and I don't live in the area, but we manage to make it up to Albany Park every few months just to go to Noon O Kabab!

Love this place. Some of the best Persian food I've ever had. They have two great locations next to each other. If you want to sit down and have full service or if you want a quick bite to eat you can pick whichever one you want.
Great food, average waiting service. Would definitely go again!

I'm always doing deliveries around that area and it's been a couple times I park right by the alley and I've seen cooks come out the alley with trays of food and raw food exposed just in bags ... I would never eat here just from what I've seen it's like if they go to a residential home to get all their food !!
Just off Brown Line Kedzie. Persian kebabs are the specialty here obviously. Lamb is tender. Sirloin is tasty. Cheese is phenomenal. Decor is very traditional, amazing.

I'm going to copy and paste what I posted on their Facebook. I think everyone should be aware of how offensive the owner is. Short Version: The food is good, but the owner is a misogynist and has no qualms expressing himself as such. Long Version: My boyfriend, best friend, and I decided to eat dinner there this evening for my boyfriend's birthday. The evening started out well. Our server was personable, charismatic, and provided excellent service. Our food came out quickly and we were enjoying our meal (discussing the dessert we were going to order as well as our second round of drinks) until the owner came by. I think it's important to mention that I was dining with two men. He asked them how their meals were and they responded happily. Then he looked at me and asked if I was a vegetarian. I said yes. Then he asked me "who told me I should be one," like somehow, as a woman, I could never make that kind of decision on my own. This is where things went seriously downhill. The restaurant owner told me I was "wrong" for being a vegetarian. He asked me if anyone had ever told me that before. I said that being from Louisiana, some people were confused by my choice-but it was my choice. Then, he proceeded to ask me what my blood type was, like that is 1) his business and 2) matters at all. At that point I was so confused I told him I was O negative (why? why did I answer??) and he just said, "You're killing yourself, you know." He went on and on for about 5 minutes, telling me that I should change my diet because of my blood type, that my voice was weak, and I looked sick...all because I'm a Vegetarian. When I told him I have been one for 20 years and was healthy, he said it "wasn't possible."  Then between telling me that my entire lifestyle and diet were wrong, he kept looking at my friend telling him that "he didn't want to lose out on rent" and we "shouldn't be offended." They weren't going to pay, I was. This kept going on and on until he could tell he offended the entire table. That's when I walked out. I guess at that point the busser came by to ask if everything was okay. My boyfriend and friend said "no," and they both acknowledged that they had to say something after having to endure a sexist rant from an owner who had no business butting into my diet. The owner came back and started apologizing, while they were telling him I was offended enough to leave and that he has no business treating guests like that. Our server came by to check on the situation, and the owner comped our meal. Somehow, he thought it was a good idea to mention that he hoped "I would come back."  I want to emphasize that our server was great. My boyfriend tried to get change for a $50 and the server wouldn't accept because of the way I was treated. They left him a tip anyway, though he did try to pass off the owner's behavior as having a "weird sense of humor," but I don't think he knew the extent of what happened. So, at 27 years old I had to sit and listen to a man tell me that I was killing myself, that I'm unaware of the decisions I make with my own body, and that I was "already weak" as a woman but was making myself worse by not eating meat. Long story long, I can't believe what happened tonight. I've never been treated like that by restaurant staff, and I worked in the industry for 10 years. We all sat in the car on the way home, trying to comprehend what happened while I cried because I felt so belittled and helpless. Excuse my language, but fuck that. I should never be made to feel helpless by someone who clearly doesn't understand medicine. By the way, I'm perfectly healthy, and I certainly don't need a man to tell me how I should eat. Never. Again. EDIT: His nephew reached out and apologized for our experience. It seems like the rest of the staff is not on board with his behavior. Unfortunately, it wasn't just his comment on my diet but also his blatant sexism that I felt were completely inappropriate. While I do appreciate their effort to make up for what happened, I can't look past this.

The Chicken Kabobs are amazing. The dill rice is delicious too. I love that they have take out restaurant across the street with a big parking lot you can park in for dine in or take out...which I feel is a must for a city restaurant. I recommend this restaurant.

Amazing kebabs! Super flavourful & juicy. The rice was plain & flavourless to my palate. Maybe it was the time which I came in & maybe was an older badge. Will define come back though. The price range is reasonable, get the special if looking to save some money.
Yum yum yum. Good service and close to home. I can't wait to visit in summer! It looks like they are making a patio. Yay!

Went here and had an amazing waitress, Celia! She was prompt and fun to have serve us our meal! She offered to make us margaritas, so we took her up on the offer. She made two beautiful mango margaritas in giant glasses. Really good! We ordered lamb and chicken kabobs and falafel. Everything was fabulous! Great fresh flavors and lots of food, fast!  We will be back and are going to insist on having Celia wait on us!

Oh my god. I love this place. Super delicious food! Fresh. Fast. Made to order. Lunch specials are HUGE portions. Too much to eat at once. Got the sultana. Delish juicy meat. Even got catering for a small event. Everything was perfect. Fresh. Even came with plates and paper products!!'

I have been going to Noon a Kabab for almost 10 years and have taken so many visiting guests there I have lost track of the number. For years it was my favorite restaurant in Chicago so it pains me to write this negative review, but after several bad experiences (and the most recent egregious one outlined below) I had to express my disappointment regarding the service and how patrons are treated. While the food is still very good (although not as good as it was years ago), I had such a negative experience there this week I do not know if I can return. Knowing that reservations can only be taken for large parties, I called about two weeks in advance to reserve a table for 12. Then I phoned back to update it to 15 as the party size increased. The day of the reservation the restaurant called and I confirmed the reservation. When I arrived everyone was there (except me) and I was told that they had given my table away and they could only set-up for two tables size-by-side. While not ideal, I understood that we would have to make it work. As I started speaking with my friends I was told that the friend of the family of the owners had yelled at several in my party for "being late" -- when I asked about this I was told he had confused our group with another. No apology for yelling at my friends. After the orders taken and food delivered we had no service at all and I had to go up to ask for my check. Overall, I did not feel welcome and of course the 18% gratuity was automatically added. While the manager tried to make amends she indicated that the owners wanted to give away the table (which does not make sense if a reservation is made) and it makes me think that they are trying to milk the previously good name for all its worth and no longer care about the experience of the customer. A very sad day indeed to see such a great place go so far downhill. I hope the owners will take a new approach in the future.

This place is absolutely fantastic. The best food and best prices. It is awesome by all measures. Specially if you go there as a group. The staff is friendly and always helping. They are all fantastic respectful and know what they are doing. We went there as a group of 25 people without previous reservation. They did great, the food was fast, delicious, and well presented. The prices were less than half of what we could have paid in other restaurants. (We paid $200-$240 for all the food and we had several boxes of leftovers. The size of the kubeideh skewer is massive, can fill one person's stomach with one of those. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

I had a really bad experience here. We planned to have a birthday dinner here and I called in the afternoon and made a reservation for dinner for a party of 13. The person on the phone confined my reservation as well. We were looking forward to it. However I was figured may run  5-10 mins late so I called an hour ahead to inform them that we would be 5-10 mins late and to my shock they tell me that there is no reservation in my name and the manager was even rude asking me who I talked to when I made the reservation. I was pleading with her if she could take a reservation bit she rudely said no and even refused to say how long the wait time was. She was one of the rudest restaurant managers I have come across...if they can't take reservations they just say so not take reservations and then back out last minute. We had to scramble last minute yo find another restaurant and change plans last minute for our birthday party. This has really left a bad taste for Noon O Kabab and I will never go there again!

Four of us ate here for our Christmas lunch (again) for my office staff and me-we'd all eaten here several times before. Great Middle Eastern food. I'm half German, half Italian. This food is a treat for the tastebuds-uniquely delicious. Started off with hummus, pita, appetizer plate with feta cheese, radishes and raw onion and a Persian salad to share between the four of us. Also had some of their wonderful freshly brewed hot tea. Two of our group had Salmon shishkabob, one filet shishkabob and I had chicken shishkabob made with freshly ground cinnamon and grilled to perfection. Three of us had the dill Basmati rice, one white rice. The dill rice was superb-no minute rice here! I'm a big boy and three of the four of us are large people. We all took home food in "doggy bags". They also have a full bar. The owner, a very attentive lady, recognized us and took over waiting on our table personally. One caution-she's very proud and if she makes a suggestion, take it! She's always right anyway. She comped our hummus and Persian salad and made us feel like family. This place is so good they have three restaurants within one block of each other and a forth about 5 miles away-they are different iterations, the one we ate at is full service, one carry out only, two counter order and pickup with tables but all with the same high quality food. Chicago treasures at a reasonable price.

Hello Everyone,  I come to this restaurant every once in a while and every time I come in here I am greeted by the manager, who has the worst attitude ever. Her name is Grace and I can't believe anyone would promote a lady with no class, no communication skills, and with a lack of professionalism. Last time I was in here she had the audacity to snatch a notebook out of my hand that did not even belong to her and then proceeded to belittle me in front of the servers. Don't get me wrong the food here is great and the servers are amazing, but the manager Grace, is terrible. I would recommend for them to find someone who smiles and treats people as human beings. She is horrible and I give this restaurant only 3 stars because the food is great.  Thank you.
Amazong Persian food, don't forget to order Tahdig and Doogh and Kabab, much better than so many Persian restaurants I've ever been to well done!

What a wonderful Persian restaurant with sweet aromas wafting all around.  Good food - real food, with real spices done just right.  Fresh-brewed tea, served in nice glasses.  Warm and caring service.  Plan to return again and again.

My husband is Persian, and Noon O Kabab is by far his favorite Persian restaurant in the city.  In fact, it's pretty much the only one we frequent.  We bring all our friends and family members here, and everybody loves it.  If you haven't had Persian food before, this is a must-try.  Persian food is fragrant and flavorful, and Noon O Kabab is the best in the city.  As a non-Persian, I thought I would give you my guide to what to order if you want to go beyond kabobs (which are excellent, don't skip them completely!): Kash-Ke-Bademjan (Appetizer) - This is an eggplant dip kind of like baba ganoush.  You eat it with pita.  It's really delicious, we order it every time! Tadiq - Persians take their rice making very seriously, and their specialty is this crispy-end-of-the-pot rice.  Noon O Kabab makes it extra delicious with their own special recipe.  Get it. Ghormeh Sabzi - This is Persian comfort food, and my husband craves it all the time.  It looks kind of weird b/c it is a stew made from mostly parsley, lamb, and kidney beans, but trust me, it's delicious.  If you really want the Persian experience, try this, you won't regret it.  You can order it with the Tadiq or as a separate entree. Fesenjan - This is a very special, difficult-to-make dish with tender chicken stewed in a walnut and pomegranate sauce.  It's soooooo good.  My in-laws mostly make it for special occasions b/c it's so time-consuming, but you can take yourself to Persian food heaven anytime at NOK. Shirin Polo with Joujeh Barg - This is one of my favorite dishes.  It's a chicken kabab with rice that is made with orange peels, carrots, raisins, butter, etc.  It's a little sweet and the chicken is delicious.   Bomieh & Zulbia - These are sweet Persian pastries that you can have as desert with a cup of Persian tea.  They are dripping with honey.  I also quite like the Baklava at NoK! Doogh - This is a yogurt and mint carbonated drink that apparently is very popular in Iran.  It took me a while to get used to, but now I order it every time we go! Ok, now I'm hungry again!  Go enjoy a Persian feast, and if you need someone to go with you b/c you want to try everything and this is obviously a ton of food, call a friend!

Best Kebabs in Town with Awesome Persian Tea. Very close to the Train Station and easy to Commute from City. Had a Combo of Chicken and Lamb Kebab. Both are Tender and best chosen Meat. The Owners are maintaining this from last 16 years. There are 3 Next to each other.  All are maintained by same owner.
Everything was delicious!!! Loved the kash-Le-bademejan. The lamb koubideh also amazing. And Jose took excellent care of us!

Noon o kabab has been a favorite for years, I no longer work near them so I'm not here often.  Found myself in the area and stopped in for lunch, wow I'd forgotten how good this place is. I had two out of town guests, it blew them away, they had no idea that food could be so good. They are from Florida and have since returned home, first email I got after the visit was them asking me to ship them food from here! I will continue coming back here.

The food is great and the service was professional. My disappointment to this place is that it's a new facility and expendable with no handicap accessibility. My son with special needs had no access to the door. The parking spaces are unlimited but for disabled parking there's only one.

Being Persian, I have high expectations when it comes to Persian food.  This restaurant is hands down one of the best Persian restaurants I've been to.  We ordered the moosir, the lamb and joujeh koubideh combo and the saffron bastani.  SO BOMB.  On top of that, the owners were very nice and accommodating.  I will definitely be back on my next trip to Chicago!  Dastatun dard nakone. Ghazatun vaghean fogholadas!!

Amazing place.. this is me writing a review 4 years after I moved out of chicago but the quality of food here is unbelievable. I was working literally two streets down from them and was there multiple times a week

Great food and good service. Very nice atmosphere. The downside is that portions are too huge and therefore prices seem high. Me and my boyfriend ordered 1 entree (shrimps, lamb, and rice) and had 1 free appetizer (for Yelp check-in. We were pretty full :) I'd recommend them to divide their portions AND prices in half so prices do not seem that scary and people won't have to take their leftovers to go :)

Love this place, love the food.  I usually do take out and every dish I've tried has been delicious.   The rice is fluffy and meat (chicken & ribeye) is juicy and flavorful. Outstanding falafels! My favorite - Persian salad.  I am not crazy about their ground chicken.   I am a frequent customer and they treat me excellent.  They treat all their customers outstanding.   Give Noon O Kabob a try.  You won't be disappointed!

I had absolutely no idea about Persian food before coming here. I got here with some Iranian friends, and I would say now this restaurant has set a standard on Persian cuisine. I had no idea how delicious it could be. First of all the service was awesome. The waitresses were so generous that even if they ordered food or doing normal conversations in Persian l, they made translations in English for me to get comfortable. The ambiance was quite good for a friday dinner time. Not too much crowded but it was quiet crowd, probably not many talkative college students like us were there. Anyways talking about the food: we ordered Tadiq with ghormeh sabzi, chicken wings with pomegranate sauce as appetizers and Lamb kabab with half dill, half plain rice as main dish. I liked the tadiq, especially how they make it (probably I'll try the same at home, just kidding). Food were really delicious, tasty but not too spicy compared to indo-pak cuisine. One unfortunate thing is we forgot to order their special Iranian desert (I was full by the time we finished the lamb kabab though). They also serve tea after the dinner, it is a Iranian custom I guess (also they made it free for us, I don't know why, they were talking in Persian, so I didn't get that part). Overall the experience was awesome. Definitely I want to try Persian again. P.S. Check in on Yelp while you are there and get a free appetizer worth not more than $7.50. I just made $7.50 less in your check. You're welcome.
This is the best Persian restaurant in town. Parvin is such a lovely and caring owner. The service and the food is awesome.

Let me start off by saying OMG. My wife and I saw Noon O Kabob on Check Please 15th Anniversary Episode last night. Everything looked great on TV and we were in the mood for a Mediterranean dinner. We arrived at the restaurant at about 5:15pm and we were immediately seated by a lovely Hostess. We quickly discovered that Noon O Kabob is actually a Persian restaurant. Our server Celia came over and introduced herself and we showed her our Yelp Coupon for a free appetizer. We ordered  a cocktail and the large Hummus to start. The Hummus with Pita pieces was the best we have ever had. My wife ordered the two Lamb Kabobs with Dill Rice and I had the Special Soprano (Filet Mignon) Kabob with another Ground Beef Kabob with Dill Rice topped with Saffron.. The staff brought us a complementary order of the Persian Salad. I'm normally not a fan of Cucumber, but this salad was amazing. The Lamb was extremely tender and the Dill Rice was to die for. My Filet Kabob was perfectly seasoned and the Ground Beef Kabob (Koubideh) was awesome. We finished off our meal with a cup of House Tea and an order of Bomieh dipped in Saffron Honey for dessert. The entire bill came to $72 before Tip. The value for your money is incredible. We have more than enough for an additional meal tomorrow. As an aside I want to thank Celia for the best service we have had in quite a while. Next time you feel like Mediterranean / Persian, I highly recommend you give Noon O Kabob a try. You will not be disappointed. Great job Noon O Kabob.
Amazing authentic Persian cuisine! No other place compares. Great service as well. Noon o kabob never disappoints. Highly recommended
I have never in my life had such bad Persian food! It had the worst quality of ingredients! I don't ever recommend to anyone

This might be the BEST kabob in Chicago. I ordered the lamb kabob and shrimp combination with dill rice (~$19). It was a big portion but everything on the plate just came together really nicely. The lamb was just right; juicy and cooked to perfection with just enough gamey smell. The shrimp was coated with lemon and cooked to perfection again; not too hard, not too soft. The shrimp was fresh and bouncy. If you'd never try dill rice before, try it. The dill rice was really really good. I think the acidity of the shrimp and the gaminess of the lamp complemented each other really well. This is really worth $19 and I would totally order this dish again! I also got a tadiq (crispy rice) with gheymeh sauce (tomato, split pea stew with beef). This dish was recommended by the menu. I personally didn't like this dish because I think the crispy rice was too crispy and could not absorb the flavor of the sauce. The gheymeh was okay by itself. Many people recommended me this place including my two Iranian friends. So that's why I came to this place and I was not disappointed. I have tried many kabob places including Oasis Cafe (cheap, good-for-the-price food), Reza's (expensive, better food) and Al Bawadi (expensive, nice ambiance, okay food). All of them are good already in my opinion, but I have to say this again, this might be the BEST place in Chicago Land to try a kabob. The service was also very good. My waitress, Celia, was very friendly, nice and very helpful. She recommended me to get the combination dish. The food came out really fast too. I highly recommend this place and I would come back here again to try their other dishes.
A great restaurant with delicious food and courteous waitresses. Their Persian food menu is elaborate and caters to every taste. The price is modest and there is ample spaces for parking.
Kababs was not cooked  good... this is my first  and  last  time ... I will never  gonna come  back here  again.

This place is great for brunch so cheap and food is exceptional! I read from some comment here that their service was bad but I got great service from them, their very attentive and checks on you frequently. Maybe dinner is a different story.

My first experience at Persian food.  Loved, loved all the food!  It has been less than a week and my husband and I are going back today.  We had a party of 6 and tried many dishes and all were excellent.  I had the Shrimp curry stew and really enjoyed this dish.  At the end of the meal we were given a small pound cake I think with cranberries.  I have to find out what this cake is and what is the recipe.  My mother would love it.  The restaurant was busy all night and service was very attentive.

We love this spot. The food is tasty and plentiful, staff is friendly, and patrons always seem convivial. It's a slightly tight fit when full, but still comfortable. There's always food left over to take home and enjoy the next day.

A great experience. Having walked in after looking for something different, I'm happy I went there. A really authentic spot. Everyone was really hospitable and our server did a great job at navigating us thru the menu. The Kebab's were really good. The fillet is a great choice.

As a persian I should say the food quality is very good in Chicago but not best. But they have one old lady that she is manager but every time that i was there she worked as a waitress and she is very aggressive and has very bad temper , she did not talk to my american friends at all and talked to me just in Farsi. She asked me multiple times to order for them. I didn't do that and this made her so mad and started to talk to me very bad and mocking me. I'm not going there any more just because of very bad service.

I went today with my son  at 3:15 pm and I treated badly. First the lady who's responsible for seating people is very rude.she seat the family that she came after us before us and I told her and they told her we came first. I don't know why that or she saw us foreigner as she and she though we are so weak to say anything. In the same day there's a man was so mad from them. We ordered hummus and salad as appetizer we have the hummus after the main dish. They serve cheese and parsley first we didn't have this too.

I myself am half Iranian so I know Persian food. My grandma raised us on making Persian food and it was of course awesome. I became a chef because of her. She would make not only amazing Persian food but incredible French food. Filets of Sole a la Bonne Femme? Yes. OMG. When I took her there and she tasted the food, she said "Wow...this tastes like back home". What higher compliment can a Persian restaurant get? Their kabob is absolutely incredible. Tender, flavorful. No salt needed. They don't skimp on the saffron either which a lot of places do because they're cheap!! Saffron is an essential ingredient in Persian cooking. Not only do they do great kabobs but they make all the legit Persian rice pilafs like "adas polo" which has raisins, nuts and I think lentils (I could be wrong). They also do the take-all-day stews like Ash (I think it's pronounced Ahsh) and gorma sabzi. And the pomegranate martinis? Awesome. They also make zoolbia I think which is like a Persian funnel cake made with rose water. If want authentic Persian food, this place is it. If anyone tells you Persian food is like Lebanese or Greek, slap them. Persian food for those who know is in a league of its own. And for those who know, like me they'd take Persian food over any other Mediterranean food any day of the week. I'm not biased. I'm just right. Keep up the good work guys!

We just loved this place. We were visiting Chicago over the weekend and on our way to to the airport we decided to stop by and grab some good food. We were late and were in rush. We asked them to bring our food earlier. They were so cooperative and within 10 minutes we had our perfect meal. We ordered "jouje barg" and just loved it.  Perfect food and service. Highly recommend this place!

Wow, this food was good! Maybe I loved it all the more because I think of Iranian (okay, "Persian") food as being boring, but this stuff was great. Chicken Koubideh was moist and flavorful, and the Ghormeh Sabzi was truly different, and delicious. My husband's lamb shank came with a wonderful broth, and the lentil and raisin topping I got for the rice was positively addictive. I think the difference between this time and former times eating at Noon O Kebab was that this time we tried the things that Iranian cuisine is rightly famous for, rather than the same old appetizers and lamb kebabs, which, though good, are sort of ho-hum by now. There are still things to try - the Fesenjan, the Tahdiq, the other rice topping - and their Persian ice creams sound so good (fig ice cream with date reduction? Yum!). Delivery was fast, and portions were generous. We will order again!

I was really looking forward to eating here, but the food and my experience were just ok.  It's a little tricky to get inside, if you park on the side of the building, the third door is the one that gets you into the restaurant.  There is free parking in a lot across the street.  Once inside, you walk past the seating area to a bar type of area, that's where they run the show from.  The restaurant was nice, clean, and bright.  I was immediately seated, but waited over 15 minutes before I was acknowledged.  With patience wearing thin, the person I assume the be the manager asked if anyone was serving me.  She rectified the situation right away, and service was spot on after that. Well, that's until it came time to pay, my server was missing again.  Never knew anyone to run from money, lol, but she soon came back and was always pleasant.  I ordered the hummus, Chenjeh and Koubideh plate, and added a skewer of Joujeh. It sounds really fancy writing it, but it's just skewers of rib eye, ground sirloin and ground chicken.  They charbroil it, and I also had the Persian Rice (dill).  Sadly the flavor just wasn't there for any of the food.  It didn't taste bad, just not flavorful.  The pita that came with the hummus was cold and kind of stiff, not good because I love good pita.  Sometime during my meal my pita basket was replaced, this time it was warm and fresh!  The hummus was pretty good, just not outstanding.  Being adventurous I was curious about the native looking drink many people were having, found out it's Doogh, a yogurt drink.  They graciously gave me a sample, let's just say it might be an acquired taste!  Reminded me of buttermilk, lol.  I enjoyed my experience, just wasn't wowed by the food.  Maybe they were having a off day, but from the reviews I was expecting really great flavor and taste.
Nice persian food and relatively good service. I ordered Barg kabab and loved it. The restaurant is kind of far away from downtown, but it's worth the drive.

great place. very authentic food.  the hummus is creeeeamy!  portions are generous.  the take away place is sometimes a quieter place to sit, esp good for lunch.  and everyone here is friendlier than at the restaurant.

I just love this place!! What great hospitality and service with a smile. Reza's used to be my favorite place but now this is my new favorite. We had steak kabob and chicken kabob and lamb kabob and they were out of this world!! I urge you all to try it

Had a great lunch here. Lamb Koubideh was perfectly cooked. Served with a delicious Persian kind of pilaf rice and grilled tomato, the ground lamb skewer was tender and juicy. The lunch specials are accompanied by pita bread and a small plate of sliced onion , parsley , feta cheese and radishes.  I did a Yelp "check in" and got a free appetizer . The freebie was called Kashke-Ke-Bademjaan. A purée of eggplant , mint, garlic ( and some other things that I just can't remember) topped with caramelized onion. Really delicious.  Great service . Great price . Delicious food.

After reading all the positive reviews , I thought I'd be able to get some good Persian food here. Not at ALL what i expected.. The only good thing here was the bread and the kashko badenjoon. We had koobideh and joojeh barg. The koobideh was horrible, big chunks of meat , not fresh at all, and had no taste! As for the joojeh barg, barg is supposed to be thin not thick! These skewers were as thick as the kabob and same thing went for this dish, no taste no freshness. In all, I drove 10 miles to get to this restaurant and i will NOT come back nor will I recommend it to anyone.

Great neighborhood restaurant. Although- I am new to the area, and from what I saw.. customers travel from a far to eat here. I think he was the owner, but, this nice man came up to me as I was eating and offered to bring me some appetizers to try. Of course, I said, yes please! He came back with a variety of hummus plates and other samples. I left with many left overs, and a full belly. Fresh food, clean establishment and friendly staff :)

This was is delicious! I had the lamb kabab and dill rice. Both were very good! For an appetizer we had the pomegranate chicken... Yummy ( a little spicy) and the hummus.  Everything was so good but the service is a little slow.

Very delicious food! The portions are huge, so while I was a little disappointed at the price, I at least got two full meals out of my dish. We went right when they opened on Sunday and were the only people in the restaurant. I highly recommend the dolma!

Not a very pleasant persian experience! The rice was from a very low quality brand and saffron smelled and tasted anything but genuine! The dill mixed with rice smelled like too old and tasted something that you may find at the back of your fridge! The onion on the side of our kabob was not fresh as well. The only star I gave to the restaurant was for its Barg kabab.

Noon O Kabab has some tasty food (and lots of it- generous portions), but I would recommend carry-out, as our dine-in experience was very choppy.  Service was not rude or disrespectful, but very aloof.  Some ordered items were missing and had to be reminded of, empty plates were very slow to be cleared from the table, and glasses of water not filled.  Their kababs are great, as is the chicken on the bone!

The waiting experience was hectic. But as soon as I ordered my food I was in heaven. Came here twice in one week. Service was fast and amazing. This became my new favorite restaurant. Very affordable. Thank u sooooo much for bringing Persian culture to Chicago!!!!!

Pretty good! Joojeh kebab and chicken wings were delicious. Lamb kebab and doogh were so-so. The service was a little slow and the food did take quite some time to come out. Great lunch prices, though!

Very delicious, authentic Persian food going on here! Recently a friend was craving for some Persian cuisine and this was the place he wanted to come to. Made the trek up from downtown through crazy traffic to eat here. Was Sunday afternoon and they had just about a full house as I am sure it was a lot of groups there for sunday dinner. We were given a nice table by the window which was nice as its good for street watching.  They brought us bread, cheese and onions to start us out and then we decided to order appetizers for the 4 of us to share. We got the Olovieh (Persian potato salad) which was really good and the Dolmeh (grape leaves with tomato saffron sauce). We also got some sort of Persian spinach that was very good over rice. They also had Efes beer which is supposed to be one of the best Mediterranean beers around...very refreshing!  After all of that I was already full and didn't need an entree.  My entree was the Soltani which is Barg (large skewer of marinated filet ) and Koubideh (ground beef sirloin with Persian seasoning) over dill rice! Both cuts of meat were delicious, but the Barg is probably the most perfect piece of seasoned meat I've ever tasted. The flavor was 2nd to none and paired with the dill rice was a lethal combination! Very big portions as well which is good if you intend to share and not be a fatty LOL! I chose to be a fatty that day! Our server was very nice and worked hard, but she broke my heart when she told me that me and my buddy drank the last Efes beers and there was no more Lebanese beer...truly disappointing but her service, great atmosphere and awesome dishes more than made up for it! Will be back!!!

I have been to Noon O Kabab quite a few times. Each time, the food is okay, nothing special in my opinion. The service each time is very slow and one of the family members of the owner (who frequently serves tables) is extremely rude and unwelcoming. I have not written a review in the past (as quite honestly, it has just been average) but after my last visit, I will not be returning. I was personally harassed by the above mentioned server as she took my order. I'm not sure why they think this behavior is acceptable but as a result, she has lost the restaurant mine and my family's business going forward.
Compared with other persian restaurants I've been to, it lacks taste and quality. On the positive side, the portions are huge and the service amazing. The persian saffron ice cream was very good.

My family has always loved Mediterranean food... Our love was taken to a whole different level after visiting Noon O Kabab! After seeing pictures of their delicious food on a friend's instagram, I convinced my parents to try this restaurant. Every single item we ordered was delicious... the Kash-Ke-Bademjan and Hummus were the most delicious appetizers I had ever had. The Persian salad was so simple yet flavorful.  The pita they bring as an appetizer is perfectly warm, and the cheese they bring with it is very flavorful.  The four of us ordered a variety of kababs including Joujeh, Barg, Koubideh, and Chenjeh. Every kebab was perfectly seasoned and juicy.  We have already recommended the restaurant to all of our family and friends and cannot wait to try their other location, NOK.

Loved it! As a Persian vegetarian, I was very impressed with all of their options. Vegetarian Fesenjoon was phenomenal...meat replaced with button mushrooms was brilliant. Definitely going to try it at home.  Also got mast moussir and dolmeh (delicious). Ash reshteh was pretty normal; nothing spectacular.  The rest of the fam got meat dishes, which met their expectations :-) Highly recommend. Didn't stay for tea, but the desert menu looked nice.

Nothing to be impressed about.  Took for ever to get my food, and when I did it did not meet my expectation. Tahdig was just rice that was put on to a pan to crisp (not a true Tahdig), and Gheimeh was tasteless and watery.   Their Kabab was just ok.   Oh, and had to wait 10-15 minutes to get my bill.  I would not go back.

I'm Middle Eastern.  I eat LOTS of Middle Eastern food, and I generally don't like to eat it at restaurants because... well... we eat it at home!  Noon O Kebab is an exception.  I eat here fairly often.  The prices are reasonable, the service is very nice and I am never ever disappointed.  I've been here at least 30 times in the last few years.  About time I wrote a review.
Yes yes yes. Come in for lunch. Get a tea. The lentil soup and joujeh (chicken kabob and rice) for under fifteen dollars. Service is fantastic and they always have a friendly face.

First time here last Saturday...the food is good. Meat was very tender. We picked up food and they forgot to include our falafel order. when we called, we were told that it would be delivered right away but the delivery never came. Pretty disappointed about this part of the service.
Had the chicken kebob with rice, it was fantastic! I moved to the neighborhood over 6 months ago, and can't believe that I waited this long to try Noon O Kebab- I will definitely be back soon!
Good food and reasonable sized portions. However, seemed understaffed when it got busy. Overall, it was a pleasant experience!
Great Persian food! Loved a rice appetizer we ordered (don't remember the name), and our kabob entrees were absolutely delicious!

Best hummus ever! Remember to do a Yelp check-in for a free app.  Lamb, chicken, and beef kabab was tender and full of flavor. The rice (we had 1/2 & 1/2) was very good and I might be the only Asian in Chicago that really doesn't like rice, but I did like Noon O Kababs!

This is one of my places to go to for Mediterranean food even though it is a bit far away. The food is delicious and well balanced. The chicken kebab and the lamb kebab were cooked well. The meat were tender, not dry and smoked with flavor. The presentation could be better but overall great effort.

This is the place to go for Persian food I the city. The menu is variety enough to pick from - fish and vegetable options. Dill rice is very tasty and food tastes always fresh. This place also serves lunches and in small portions (like a wrap/sandwich style) to test in case you are not so familiar with Persian dishes.  One of the things I really like is their feta cheese. Not sure if they make it in the house or buy it from somewhere but it is very tasty and really wonderful to eat with slices of onion and parsley in pita bread. It is simple but it is very good.

The owner responded with a very nice note apologizing for the manager. A very nice gesture. The food is fantastic so I'll definitely go back.  Fantastic food. Great kabobs, hummus, seafood and anything else. About the only negative thing on a recent visit was the nasty, manager-type woman in black. She was sitting next to our table chatting with friends when my 7-year-old slightly pushed her chair into hers..
We ordered koubideh and joujeh kebabs. Excellent kebabs! Moosir will make one go back there
Amazing food and service!! Potent tastes and flavors. If you're looking to go off meat with a bang then the family platter is the best decision you'll make.

I absolutely love this place. Great date night! The food is always Persian and always delicious. I love their chicken kobideh. My husband wanted to see pics of the dishes since he has never been here before and I think that would be helpful. But all their food is appetizing. Been here for several events. The tea is also amazing with dessert so, you gotta try it out. Again the kobideh is delicious and not spicy but super savory! Enjoy this place.
Awesome Persian Food and Service!--Live in the north suburbs and delivery has been great! Everything is top notch on the menu especially the kabobs!

Came in this week to grab some Persian food -- and did leave satisfied. We had a party of 8, were seated immediately, and the service was good. The food was good - we started with a ton of spreads - the hummus, baba ghanouj, tabouli, and upon our waitress's request, the Kashk-ke-Bademjan, a warm eggplant dish with onion garlic and yogurt -- very good. There were whispers around the table that the hummus was 'the best hummus everrrrr', but I think some of my fellow diners were just very hungry. For mains we ordered the family platter, which comes with a a whole variety of meats, a filet, a sirloin (someone said 'oh this one tastes like hamburger!'), ribeye, and chicken. We also got an order of the lamb koubideh and the salmon, which was 'highly recommended!' on the menu. Well, I'd recommend it too, as that was probably everyone's favorite dish of the night. The meats came with a full plate of rice -- for every single person at the table. Seemed a little excessive to me but......'MERICA!  Overall, good food in a nice restaurant with good service. I'd recommend if you're a fan of Persian food, or just generally enjoy meats, rice, and spices. Do it.
